item.title: [P.I] Can't attack anything
item.dc:creator: @nathanz nathanz
item.description:
@nathanz wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:555011”]This right here, would be why we use things like github…

okay so if it “reaches the method alright” the error is in your combat assistant.

You also need to do a bit better debugging. Just adding trace methods isn’t enough. Trace values at the same time. Like check if “checkMagicReqs(c.magicId)” is returning true or false (Depending if you have the runes/spell/etc)[/quote]

Fixed this problem. It had me going for days but eventually it was found in the process method.

Read full topic

item.title: [P.I] Can't attack anything
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

This right here, would be why we use things like github…

okay so if it “reaches the method alright” the error is in your combat assistant.

You also need to do a bit better debugging. Just adding trace methods isn’t enough. Trace values at the same time. Like check if “checkMagicReqs(c.magicId)” is returning true or false (Depending if you have the runes/spell/etc)

item.title: [P.I] Can't attack anything
item.dc:creator: @nathanz nathanz
item.description:
@nathanz wrote:

Runique Release:

Any clue what classes you were looking into? You may have put a return code within your attacknpc.java (for example)… Little bit more information would be great.

Yes AttackNpc and AttackPlayer are the methods that it’s most likely messed up in. I have added print outs after each return and it reaches the method alright.

Here’s my AttackPlayer and AttackNpc methods:

AttackPlayer:
http://pastebin.com/EgXwy6k7

AttackNpc:
http://pastebin.com/kp9DdqD6
